tagline: Runs CI/CD, cloud infrastructure, Kubernetes, databases, and SRE across AWS, GCP, and Azure
pros: Operates across all three major clouds and most infrastructure tools without vendor bias
Builds complete CI/CD pipelines from code push to production deploy with rollback
Combines SRE discipline (SLOs, incident response, post-mortems) with hands-on infrastructure work
Keeps cost visibility as a first-class concern — won't over-provision 'just to be safe'
cons: Breadth across clouds and tools means less depth than a dedicated AWS or Kubernetes specialist
Won't handle advanced networking (BGP, custom VPN tunnels) or niche cloud services
Infrastructure generalism can slow down teams that need deep expertise in a specific cloud's proprietary services

model_recommendations.notes: Complex reasoning, architecture, security, or financial analysis. Needs the best available model with full thinking/reasoning enabled.
